gil.io
Interface ISimulatorNativeBoundary

public interface ISimulatorNativeBoundary

Interface that may be used as a template when there is a need to implement part of the process model adapter in a different language than Java.

Method Summary
 int getSystemVariables(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
          Returns the systems variables.
 int readData(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
          Reads data from the process model.
 int setup(SignalMetadata[] writeSignals, SignalMetadata[] readSignals, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> config)
          Defines list of signals read and written with readData and writeData.
 void tearDown()
          Gives the native code a chance to do cleanup.
 int writeData(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
          Writes data to the process model.
 

Method Detail

setup

int setup(SignalMetadata[] writeSignals,
          SignalMetadata[] readSignals,
          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> config)
Defines list of signals read and written with readData and writeData.

Returns:
0 on success and -1 on failure.

tearDown

void tearDown()
Gives the native code a chance to do cleanup. Must be called last to do cleanup. A single call to tearDown is enough even if setup has been called several times.

readData

int readData(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
Reads data from the process model. The given buffer must be of a size enough to receive signal data according to the readSignals setup. Signal data is returned in buffer in the same order as signal metadata given when calling setup.

Returns:
0 on success and -1 on failure

writeData

int writeData(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
Writes data to the process model. The given buffer must be of a size according to the writeSignals setup. Signal data must be in the same order as signal metadata given when calling setup.

Returns:
0 on success and -1 on failure

getSystemVariables

int getSystemVariables(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
Returns the systems variables.

The buffer will after the call contain variables such as clock, status, icNumber etc. depending on the concrete implementation of this interface.

Returns:
0 on success and -1 on failure
